description:
Mononoke is a spin-off of the Bakeneko story arc of Ayakashi: Japanese Classic Horror. It follows the Medicine Seller as he deals with various spirits or "Mononoke" in feudal Japan. Just like in the Bakeneko story, he combats with a series of tools and his vast knowledge of the supernatural on his side, but can only slay the Mononoke when he uncovers its form (Katachi), the truth behind its appearance (Makoto) and the reason for its unusual behavior (Kotowari).

(Source: Wikipedia)

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Anthology
tags.description: A collection of separate works collated into a single release.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Oiran
tags.description: Prominently features a courtesan character of the Japanese Edo Period.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description: Juju is a Japanese jazz singer. She is represented by Sony Music Associated Records Inc. She currently resides in New York City.
Ryota Komatsu is a Japanese bandoneón player. He has cooperated with famous Japanese violinist Taro Hakase in his own album La Trampera (2001), and with Bajofondo in their album Mar Dulce.
Ryota Komatsu is a Japanese bandoneón player. He has cooperated with famous Japanese violinist Taro Hakase in his own album La Trampera (2001), and with Bajofondo in their album Mar Dulce.
Ryota Komatsu is a Japanese bandoneón player. He has cooperated with famous Japanese violinist Taro Hakase in his own album La Trampera (2001), and with Bajofondo in their album Mar Dulce.
Taizou Itou is an animation producer.

Freelance director originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Known for having directed shows such as [Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/2246/), [Welcome to Irabu's Office](https://anilist.co/anime/6774/) and [Tsuritama](https://anilist.co/anime/12883/) among others. He was also set to serve as an assistant director to [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/) on [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/), but this was later scrapped due to creative differences with [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/), who ended up directing the film himself.
Youko Matsuzaki is a producer at Fuji TV.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.
Currently an Executive Producer at MAPPA. Formerly at Toei Animation.
He was a scriptwriter and animation producer previously working for [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).
Takeshi Himi is a CG producer.
